education.field_of_study: English, Science, Social Studies, Hindi, Sanskrit

projects.title: Automated Order Entry
projects.description:
AOE is a middleware application which interacts with several upstream and downstream systems to get required order information based on the quote loaded.
There are several quoting systems (BMI, NGQ, and Watson) in HPE. The quotes from these quoting systems are loaded into AOE UI to create an Order.
A Business User fills the required order information and fetches other details interacting with other services providers. This Order is created in the Fulfillment System (SAP Fusion) and user receives the HP Order Number.

Roles & Responsibilities
1. Delivering user stories in an Agile Developement Environment following scrum process.
2. Developing and owning the Pricing Component of the Application.
3. Developing on creating SOAP/REST based services.
4. Developed a POC for creating a new Async Workflow using Spring-Kafka.
5. Interacting with AppSupport team in ensuring High Availability of the Application.
6. Working closly with senior & junior developers and BAs across the project and globe.
7. Working closely with QA Team & Business Team on the monthly releases and tasks.
8. Interacting with Upstream & Downstream Systems based on the user story requirement.
9. Identifying and fixing all the Security gaps(XSS, Cross-Site scripts and SQL Injection) in the application addressed by HP Fortify Security Team.
10. Analyzing on Memory Issues.

Tools Used:  Spring Framework, Java, AngularJS

projects.title: WFM - Workflow Management
projects.description:
WorkFlowManagement is a Case Management Tool which will create cases and tasks manually, automatically for the users

Roles & Responsibilities: 

Delivering user stories in an Agile Developement Environment following scrum process. 
Developing new processes in Tibco BW. 
Managing(CRUD) the Configuration, Groups and User data in JSON formats. 
Collaborating with Tibbr in storing the attachment received for the case created by business users.
Deploying the BW Code base on Monthly Releases.
Developing new libraries in java that are required to be plugged with Tibco BW processes.
Providing support for more locales in the email communication to the Business Users.
Collaborating with upstream(OUMI) and reference system like COR.

Tools Used : Tibco AMX BW, Tibco AMX BPM, TIbco EMS, Core Java, JSON, XML, Tibco Tibbr, velocity Templates.

projects.title: MindSet System
projects.description: filling space for OMT MindSet Project

projects.title: Order Integration Suite
projects.description:
Order Integration Suite is a middleware system which manages all the orchestration flow to various fulfillment systems. 
Orders are received from various sources upstream systems of various formats. WebMethod does the orchestration of all 
these formats and converts them into an IDOC which is understandably by Fusion System.

projects.title: ECOMPENSATION
projects.description:
eCompensation is GE's Internal HRMS portal which maintains the GE employee's compensation details. This data is extracted from Oracle HR Systems for Compensation Planning and loaded into eComp. Later, eComp does planning for employees at a Marco level dealing business groups, organization level, business segments and at sub-business level. eComp provides various roles like compensation manager, compensation specialist, plan owner, sysadmin who can create/view/edit plans based on the permission into the application. After planning for employee's the plans are loaded back to OHR.

Responsibilities
•	Working on the development modules of the application.
•	Working on the Release activities and driving in a successful release every month.
•	Working on the Non-Release activities like fixing bugs mostly DB related.
•	Performing SVN Lead activities in maintaining the code after every release like branch creation, merging to trunk.
•	Active interlocking with the client periodically and maintaining an effective on-shore/off-shore communication among the team.

projects.title: Commodore, Goldman Sachs, GBS
projects.description:
Commodore is the core Middleware Application of Goldman Sachs which maintains the entire client’s upstream data like trading, positions, stocks, bonds and securities. The obtained data is enriched based on the MarginID in the falconizer. The business in GS is categorized under Investment Banking, Proprietary Business, Prime Brokerage, Portfolio Margin, and Franchise.  Based on the business type, we have various calculator components which would run the calculations for the MarginID. Once the Calculations are complete, the values are updated in the Database. A graph is generated on a daily basis for the MarginID. At the EOD, the reports are visible in Ocean UI that is picked up by the operator for verification.

Responsibilities
•	Involved in developing new features for the PB Classic Migration Project.
•	Writing JUnit Test cases, Bug Fixes and interacting with onshore & offshore team. 
•	Involved in writing Stored Procedures and SQL Join queries.

projects.title: Leap CMS Scotia Bank, GBS
projects.description:
Leap CMS is a front end for Scotia online Retail Bank Application initially handled in Mainframes servers. Transformation of the front end is happening in Java and IBM’s UI framework. It is dealing with Scotia Globe for all transaction via broker and batch.

Responsibilities
•	Understanding the project by going through the document.
•	Taking KT from the onsite team.
•	Fixing bugs from the previous version of leapcms.

projects.title: Autonomic Computing, IBM Software Labs
projects.description:
Log Analyzer (LA) is an eclipse based stand-alone tool for viewing, analyzing, and correlating logs, filtering, reporting using the Eclipse Test and Performance Tools Platform. Logs can be imported from various repositories either locally or remotely. LA enables you to import and select symptom catalogs against which log files can be analyzed and correlated. This interface provides the support for all the products across IBM by determining the root cause of the problem in a system reducing the amount of time involved for a user to debug, resolve and suggests a possible solution using symptom catalogs.

Responsibilities:
•	Worked on the Analyzing, developing and testing phase of the above products.
•	Working and fixing on bugs for the interim product’s release.
•	Involved in developing parsers and various catalog generations using SCMT Tool.
•	Involved in the testing phase of LA, SE and AOA for every release.

Initiatives
•	Initiated and worked on the shadowing process as an L1 operator in interacting with Tivoli Storage Manager team in understanding and making TSM adapt to use with LA. 
•	Involved in the solution health process of setting up Log Searcher project using MAVEN.
•	Obtained an opportunity to learn and build applications using WebSphere sMash.

projects.title: Etracks, Java Technology Center, IBM Software Labs
projects.description:
Etracks, a Metrics Tracking Tool is designed as a web application that captures Metrics information for Java L3 team across Bangalore only. These metrics are Problem Management Record (PMR), Customer’s Critical & Hot Situations, Workload, backlog, headcount and productivity for each user in the team. Each user is provided a login where he/she can view the pmrs that are in open/closed/resolved status. The views and privileges differ based on the role of login from a user to a manager. Etracks runs a scheduler that picks up required pmr information on a daily basis from the IBM repository, RETAIN and updates the local DB2 database.  Reports are generated based on the daily metrics that help the management for tracking.
CHMS is CritSit HotSit Management System that maintains all open, resolved and closed situations by a pmr owner. Each situation is associated with a pmr number. CHMS provides an interface to manually create a situation which gets updated using the pmr information. Similar to Etracks, CHMS provides different view based on login of a user, a team lead and a manager.

Responsibilities
•	Contributed to successful maintenance of Etracks application by enhancing existing features, fixing bugs, and incorporating new features as per the requirement from the management or from the team. 
•	Implemented Headcount’s view and daily workload tracker in PHP for the team.
•	Contributed in the team’s success by generating and delivery Reports and Metrics data to the Management and Team on a daily, weekly and monthly frequency.

Technologies : Java, JSP, Servlets, HTML, JavaScript, DB2, Tomcat 6

projects.title: SWAMP, Java Technology Center, IBM Software Labs
projects.description:
SWAMP is an IBM’s W3 project designed as a web application tool to support multiple levels of Java Service Organization. It helps Service engineers and managers to track day-to-day work and provide statistical reports of workload trends. SWAMP act as a super set on the existing tools like Etracks, CHMS, Eureka and many other related tools overcoming the limitations by integrating them such that making all the metrics availability at a single place that will help the Java L3 Organization across cross geographic team at IBM. SWAMP uses the existing IBM repositories like CQDB, STMT, RETAIN to extract pmr, situations, and defects details of an individual and provides statistical information to the organization in desired reporting structure.

Responsibilities:
•	Actively involved in all the phases of the project right from the start.
•	Analyzing and designing the system as per the requirements.
•	Involved in the development part of the application.
•	Contributing in the Unit Testing using JUnit.
•	Contributed in the Design and Development of the front end.
•	Contributed in the documentation part of the application.
•	Regular Interlocking with the Hursley team on the development of project.

Technologies : Java, JSP, Servlets, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, DB2, Hibernate, 
 Tomcat 5.5, Eclipse 3.2

projects.title: Survey Evaluation Assessment & Management System (SEAMS)
projects.description:
SEAMS is a Web Application created for a Client who needs to acquire Feedback from the Customers about the product launched by their Company in the market. The Client is allowed to create certain Evaluations and Sections. Based on the different sections we can insert a set of questions for survey purpose. A link is generated by the administrator and is placed at the Client’s Home page. Customers access the link and answer the questions to the respective questions. These responses are summarized and are accessible by the Client in a graphical representation using charts. This application is implemented in administrative side and also in the maintenance section. 

Responsibilities
•	Involved in the analysis of the specifications provided. 
•	Involved in the designing and the developing modules of the application.
•	Involved in the testing phase of the application.

projects.title: Electronic Professional Information Center (EPIC)
projects.description:
EPIC, Electronic Professional Information Center (e-PIC) is a “Personal Information Manager” for physicians. PIM typically focuses on basic contacts and time management. It assists in managing daily appointments, telephone lists and tasks. e-PIC moves beyond the PIM concepts by providing back-office services in support of the physician’s patient management and professional development responsibilities. The physician or his staff will configure e-PIC. This will be accomplished through a set of interview questions. The question will identify the physician’s specialty and configure the e-PIC web pages appropriately. The appointment area of the dashboard will provide a summary view of the most recent information.
Responsibilities
•	Involved in the analysis of the specifications provided. 
•	Involved in the designing and the developing modules of the application.
•	Involved in the testing phase of the application.

Tools	:   ColdFusion, SQL Server 2003
